intro: Lettsomia setosa var. minor, commonly known as the lesser hairy lettsomia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and small, clustered umbels of white flowers. The leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. This variant is typically found in moist, woodland environments across its native range. Its botanical features make it a notable species for ecological and horticultural studies.
